projects.title: CubeSat ADCS Concept & Simulation
projects.summary: Concept trades and simulation workflow for small-satellite attitude determination and control.

photos.caption: ADCS concept overview and simulation flow.
Control loop block diagram used for analysis.

whatIDid: Defined ADCS requirements and pointing error budget for a 3U CubeSat class mission.
Built a simulation workflow to evaluate candidate sensor/actuator configurations.
Documented assumptions, test cases, and verification checks for repeatable analysis.
results: Produced a down-select matrix comparing multiple ADCS architectures.
Validated stability and pointing performance against defined scenarios.

projects.title: Pulsejet Engine Design & Testing
projects.summary: Obtained funding from Makerspace NYC to develop my very own propane powered jet engine from scratch.

photos.caption: Bench test configuration for the pulsejet prototype.
CAD model used to iterate geometry prior to fabrication.

whatIDid: Used Mill, Lathe, Welding Iron, and other machines required for this project.
Designed hydrulic valive system to control the fluid flow rate and pressure for liquid birpopellant release
results: Demonstrated mastery of fabrication and fluid dynamics.
Created a cool frickin rocket engine.

projects.title: Bioelectric Signal Processing: Mind Controlled Rover
projects.summary: Used the Backyard Brains SpikerBox to collect data from both EMG (muscle movement signals) and EEG (brain wave signals) to move a mechanical rover.

photos.caption: We graphed the graphs from the EEG and EMG signals to better understand how they work.

whatIDid: Created a system to measure certain oscillations in the brain and map them to rover movements.
Created a small neural net to map certain waveforms to particular emotions / focus levels
results: Improved test repeatability by standardizing setup and measurement steps.
Identified a transient overshoot condition and proposed mitigation options.

projects.title: Studdy Buddy Web App
projects.summary: Study Buddy is a sleek and clean web app I built to make studying more fun and less stressful by turning it into a series of mini-games. It includes three main modes—Test, Match, and Sprint—each offering a different way to review material in a more interactive and engaging format.
whatIDid: Designed and built the full-stack app: UI/UX, responsive front end (HTML/Bootstrap + JavaScript/React), and Flask backend integration.
Created and implemented a MySQL database schema and queries to store/retrieve study content for the database-driven game modes.
Developed core gameplay logic across modes, including drag-and-drop interactivity, real-time validation/feedback, scoring systems, and lightweight on-the-fly problem generation for Sprint.
results: Increased study effectiveness through structured multiple-choice practice with instant correctness feedback.
Improved user motivation by awarding points and making progress measurable throughout a session.
Delivered consistent question accuracy and replayability by pulling content from a centralized database.

projects.title: AccelSpin: High-Speed Rotational Launcher for Projectile Deployment
projects.summary: I designed and built a mechanical system capable of launching projectiles vertically into the air using 1000 RPM rotational energy.
whatIDid: Designed and fabricated a rotational-energy launcher using a arm driven by a high-torque electric motor.
Implemented tunable speed control to adjust launch force based on projectile mass and target altitude.
Incorporated stability and safety considerations for high-speed motion
results: Achieved consistent, repeatable vertical launch trajectories by releasing projectiles at a controlled, calculated point near peak angular velocity.
Reached stable high-speed operation up to 1000 RPM through vibration control and secure mounting, improving reliability and safety.
Created a practical test platform for validating real-world projectile motion and trajectory modeling under variable launch conditions.

projects.title: Autonomous Control: Thrust Vector Control (TVC) and Airbrakes for Model Rocketry
projects.summary: I designed and built reusable model rockets with embedded systems that control orientation and position during launch
whatIDid: Designed and built a servo-controlled gimbal-based TVC system to redirect motor thrust and produce controlled pitch/yaw adjustments.
Engineered deployable airbrakes optimized to generate drag while minimizing instability and adverse performance effects during ascent.
Integrated both subsystems into a single flight-control approach, aligning mechanical design and actuation timing around key phases (initial launch and near-peak).
results: Improved flight control and maneuverability by enabling real-time trajectory adjustments through thrust vectoring during powered flight.
Increased ascent consistency and reduced overshoot by deploying airbrakes near apogee to add controllable drag and manage altitude.
Enabled more sophisticated flight profiles by combining propulsion-based control (TVC) with drag inducing aerodynamic control (airbrakes) for multi-phase guidance.
